content:
Hi All, now that the May code freeze is on we are working on getting the dotnet client ready to go.
At this point we have a version committed to git that has the latest models available and the entire project builds.
Some of the unit tests are failing and we are working on getting these fixed (not sure if some are server or the c# code issues)
Will update when there is news to share, hoping it won't be long.
Update on the code, the unit tests pass except for this pesky decimal precision issue, and some weird issue with binary conversion between XML/json (don't know what it is yet)
The basic CRUD/search has been tested against Grahame's server and works now.
So core and model are good now, and the Valueset/Codesystem operations have been updated too.
Other functionality outside this hasn't been touched, so can't be sure.
If you're game, please grab the code from github in the *ft-connectathon-may2016* branch and build away and let us know how you go.

Ewout, can you update the NuGet package info in there and publish a new version of the stuff?
(Not sure if this should be called FHIR - 2016 May Connectathon rather than STU3)
